p: Figure 11a shows that the onset for the monomer oxidation in a DCE-based electrolyte is significantly cathodically shifted (by ca. 500 mV) in [NiAmben] vs. [NiSalen]. Easier oxidation of the N 4 complex likely results from higher radical delocalization over ligand scaffold in Ni II–anilinyl radical cations [ 21] as compared with the isoelectronic Ni II–phenoxyl radical cation species [ 45].
